result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $504.00 to Pick N Save at 4145 N. Oakland Avenue,  Shorewood, WI.; and $237.85 joint and several with codefendant in 15CF1083 to George Webb 3133 S. 92 Street, Milwaukee, WI.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  
Monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance  of costs/surcharges and restitution would be then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
No contact with and keep separate from codefendant JB Hankins.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain HSED or GED.  Seek and maintain employment.

No contact with Jane S., Amber W., Pick N Save at 4145 N. Oakland Avenue, Shorewood, WI.; or George Webb at 3133 S. 92 Street, Milwaukee, WI.
No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed for defendant by a duly licensed physician for his mental or physical needs. Take as prescribed and only for as long as deemd medically reasonable and necessary.
No alcohol.
No contact with codefendant JB Hankins.
AODA  assessment, treatment if needed. Urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
The Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

records.addlTxt:
Original Transcript (30 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing July 28, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
/and Restitution Worksheet (2), received and filed.
Sentencing Memorandum, submitted on behalf of defendant, received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.
/and Restitution Worksheets (2), filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 20.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Parties request another Scheduling conference.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in custody.  Ronald Dague for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Dominic Somk Panhyasiri
Current: 2715 W MCKINLEY AVE, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 04-23-2015)
Prior: 3860 N 4th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY GEORGE WEBB'S RESTAURANT OR ANY PICK N' SAVE GROCERY STORE; AND CO-ACTOR:  J.B. HANKINS.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dominic Somk Panhyasiri in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
